penfactory

Class Assortment

  • java.lang.Object
    • penfactory.Assortment

  • public class Assortment
extends java.lang.Object
    Handles the database. Makes it possible to add new products to the Database. Makes it possible to remove products. Makes it possible to increase or decrease the amount of existing products. Removing all products from one category. Checks for valid properties for new products.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Assortment()
      Sets the pop-up-window for adding products.

    • Method Detail

      • removeSelectedProduct

        void removeSelectedProduct(javax.swing.JFrame frame,
                           javax.swing.JTable tableDatabase,
                           javax.swing.table.DefaultTableModel tableModel)
        Removes the currently selected product(s) from the Database. It is possible to remove multiple Entries at once when they are all selected.
        Parameters:
        frame - The frame of the GUI window.
        tableDatabase - The graphical table in which the Database is displayed.
        tableModel - The Database in which all product entries were saved.

      • removeProductInstances

        void removeProductInstances(javax.swing.JSpinner spinnerRemoveProductInstances,
                            javax.swing.JTable tableDatabase,
                            javax.swing.table.DefaultTableModel tableModel,
                            javax.swing.JFrame frame)
        Removes/adds instances from/to a product. If a negative number was entered this amount will be removed from the product's amount. If a positive number was entered this amount will be added to the product's amount.
        Parameters:
        spinnerRemoveProductInstances - The GUI spinner which displays the amount of products that will be added/removed.
        tableDatabase - The graphical table in which the Database is displayed.
        tableModel - The Database in which all product entries were saved.
        frame - The frame of the GUI window.

      • removeCategory

        void removeCategory(java.lang.String categoryToRemove,
                    javax.swing.JFrame frame,
                    javax.swing.JTable tableDatabase,
                    javax.swing.table.DefaultTableModel tableModel)
        Every entry which belongs to the category will be listed. Then the user is asked by the system if all data should be deleted.
        Parameters:
        categoryToRemove - The Category which should be removed.
        frame - The frame of the GUI window.
        tableDatabase - The graphical table in which the Database is displayed.
        tableModel - The Database in which all product entries were saved.

      • addProduct

        void addProduct(javax.swing.table.DefaultTableModel tableModel)
        Opens a window and asks for the product attributes. The attributes will be checked for following constraints: name - can not be empty weight (in gram) - must be a positive integer place - must be an integer category - can not be empty price (in cents) - must be a positive integer greater 0 amount - must be a positive integer If one attribute is not correct a message to the user will be shown explaining the errors.
        Parameters:
        tableModel - The Database in which all product entries were saved.

      • checkValidWeight

        public boolean checkValidWeight(java.lang.String str)
        Check if the entered weight is valid(integer greater than zero).
        Parameters:
        str - The weight which should be checked.
        Returns:
        true - if the entered weight is valid. false - if the entered weight is not valid.

      • checkValidPlace

        public java.lang.String checkValidPlace(javax.swing.JTextField[] textFields,
                                        javax.swing.table.DefaultTableModel tableModel)
        Checks if the entered place is valid(integer and place is not taken).
        Parameters:
        textFields - All text-fields of the pop-up-window
        tableModel - The Database in which all product entries were saved.
        Returns:
        "Merged with same article! \n" - if the same article is located at this place. "Place already taken! \n" - if a different article is located at this place. "No valid place was entered! \n" - if the entered string is not an integer. "true" - if the input is valid.

      • checkValidPrice

        public boolean checkValidPrice(java.lang.String str)
        Check if the entered price is valid(integer greater than zero).
        Parameters:
        str - The price which should be checked.
        Returns:
        true - if the entered price is valid. false - if the entered price is not valid.

      • checkValidAmount

        Check if the entered amount is valid(integer greater than zero).
        Parameters:
        str - The amount which should be checked.
        Returns:
        true - if the entered amount is valid. false - if the entered amount is not valid.
